info.description: he Apache-XML-Security-J 1.4 supports XML-Signature Syntax and Processing, W3C Recommendation 12 February 2002 and XML Encryption Syntax and Processing, W3C Recommendation 10 December 2002 As of version 1.4, the Java library supports the standard Java API JSR-105: XML Digital Signature APIs for creating and validating XML Signatures. A standard Java API for XML Encryption JSR-106: XML Digital Encryption APIs is in progress and is not final, so this API is not yet supported. You can continue to use the existing non-standard APIs in the Java Library (there are no plans to discontinue or deprecate them), but you should consider moving to the standard APIs.
